clusters.title: Elon Musk celebrates $1tn Tesla pay vote victory
clusters.neutral_headline: Elon Musk Wins Approval for Tesla Pay Package

items.title: Elon Musk celebrates $1tn Tesla pay vote victory
items.standfirst: Record package of shares wins 75% approval, reinforcing billionaire’s control of the electric-car maker
items.content: Record package of shares wins 75% approval, reinforcing billionaire’s control of the electric-car maker

items.title: Elon Musk wins approval for record $1 trillion Tesla pay package
items.standfirst: Tesla shareholders voted on Thursday to approve CEO Elon Musk’s record-breaking pay deal — the largest in corporate history — endorsing his ambitious plan to transform the electric carmaker into a powerhouse of artificial intelligence and robotics. The package could grant Musk stock worth up to $1 trillion over the next decade.
items.content: Tesla shareholders voted on Thursday to approve CEO Elon Musk’s record-breaking pay deal — the largest in corporate history — endorsing his ambitious plan to transform the electric carmaker into a powerhouse of artificial intelligence and robotics. The package could grant Musk stock worth up to $1 trillion over the next decade.

items.title: Tesla shareholders approve $1 trillion pay package for Musk
items.standfirst: More than 75% of votes were cast in favor of the unprecedented pay plan, the company said Thursday at its annual meeting.
items.content: More than 75% of votes were cast in favor of the unprecedented pay plan, the company said Thursday at its annual meeting.

items.title: Elon Musk could become trillionaire with new Tesla pay package
items.standfirst: Tesla that shareholders had voted to approve the biggest pay package in corporate history for CEO Elon Musk, in a deal worth up to $1 trillion over 10 years. NBC News' Brian Cheung explains the benchmarks the company would have to hit for Musk to get his payday.
items.content: Tesla that shareholders had voted to approve the biggest pay package in corporate history for CEO Elon Musk, in a deal worth up to $1 trillion over 10 years. NBC News' Brian Cheung explains the benchmarks the company would have to hit for Musk to get his payday.

items.title: Some Tesla Shareholders Want It to Invest in xAI. The Board Isn’t So Sure
items.standfirst: Elon Musk gets a mixed response to his idea of having the carmaker invest in his artificial-intelligence startup.
items.content: Elon Musk gets a mixed response to his idea of having the carmaker invest in his artificial-intelligence startup.

items.title: Elon Musk's $1tn pay deal approved by Tesla shareholders
items.standfirst: The richest man in the world will get hundreds of millions of new shares if he hits his targets.
items.content: The richest man in the world will get hundreds of millions of new shares if he hits his targets.

items.title: How Tesla shareholders put Elon Musk on path to be world’s first trillionaire
items.standfirst: A staggering compensation package has been approved – but what does Musk have to do to reap the full rewards?Now that Tesla stockholders have approved a plan to offer Elon Musk close to $1tn, the clock is ticking to make the company worth eight times more than it is today.If Musk can grow Tesla to over $8tn in value for stockholders over the next decade, he will be well on his way to becoming the world’s first trillionaire. Continue reading...
items.content: A staggering compensation package has been approved – but what does Musk have to do to reap the full rewards?Now that Tesla stockholders have approved a plan to offer Elon Musk close to $1tn, the clock is ticking to make the company worth eight times more than it is today.If Musk can grow Tesla to over $8tn in value for stockholders over the next decade, he will be well on his way to becoming the world’s first trillionaire. items.title: Musk could become world's 1st trillionaire as Tesla shareholders approve giant pay package
items.standfirst: Elon Musk won a shareholder vote on Thursday that would give the Tesla CEO stock worth $1 trillion if he hits certain performance targets over the next decade, handing him a chance to become history's first trillionaire.
items.content: Elon Musk won a shareholder vote on Thursday that would give the Tesla CEO stock worth $1 trillion if he hits certain performance targets over the next decade, handing him a chance to become history's first trillionaire.

items.title: Tesla shareholders approve CEO Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay package
items.standfirst: The vote comes after a top shareholder, Norway's sovereign wealth fund, said it would vote against the pay package.
items.content: The vote comes after a top shareholder, Norway's sovereign wealth fund, said it would vote against the pay package.

items.title: Tesla shareholders approve $1 trillion pay package for Elon Musk tied to ambitious targets
items.standfirst: The compensation plan gives Musk more control over Tesla, but he's been clear about wanting a specific level of ownership for a particular reason. Here's why he says his stake needs to be large enough to prevent one scenario, but not so large that another can't happen.
items.content: The compensation plan gives Musk more control over Tesla, but he's been clear about wanting a specific level of ownership for a particular reason. Here's why he says his stake needs to be large enough to prevent one scenario, but not so large that another can't happen.

items.title: Tesla shareholders approve $1tn pay package for Elon Musk
items.standfirst: Chants of ‘Elon’ erupt after compensation plan approved despite opposition from several high-profile investorsTesla shareholders approved a $1tn compensation plan for CEO Elon Musk on Thursday, awarding the world’s richest person what would be the largest corporate payout in history if he meets the goals necessary to receive it.The pay package, which several high-profile investors opposed, demonstrates that shareholders still believe Musk can lead the automaker in an era dominated by robotics and artificial intelligence. Continue reading...
items.content: Chants of ‘Elon’ erupt after compensation plan approved despite opposition from several high-profile investorsTesla shareholders approved a $1tn compensation plan for CEO Elon Musk on Thursday, awarding the world’s richest person what would be the largest corporate payout in history if he meets the goals necessary to receive it.The pay package, which several high-profile investors opposed, demonstrates that shareholders still believe Musk can lead the automaker in an era dominated by robotics and artificial intelligence. Continue reading...

items.title: Tesla Shareholders Approve Elon Musk’s $1 Trillion Pay Package
items.standfirst: The unprecedented payday will go into full effect by 2035—as long as Tesla hits ambitious financial and production targets.
items.content: The unprecedented payday will go into full effect by 2035—as long as Tesla hits ambitious financial and production targets.

items.title: Tesla shareholders approve $878bn pay plan for Elon Musk
items.standfirst: Shareholders approved the pay package with as much as 75 percent support on Thursday.
items.content: Shareholders approved the pay package with as much as 75 percent support on Thursday.

items.title: Tesla Shareholders Approve $1 Trillion Pay Package for Elon Musk
items.standfirst: Tesla Inc. shareholders approved a potential $1 trillion compensation package for Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk, the largest payout ever awarded to a corporate leader. Musk would have to meet certain goals to get the full payout. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
items.content: Tesla Inc. shareholders approved a potential $1 trillion compensation package for Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk, the largest payout ever awarded to a corporate leader. Musk would have to meet certain goals to get the full payout. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

items.title: Tesla shareholders approve Elon Musk's trillion-dollar pay package
items.standfirst: Tesla shareholders have approved a pay package for Elon Musk that could allow him to earn an unprecedented one trillion dollars' worth of stock.
items.content: Tesla shareholders have approved a pay package for Elon Musk that could allow him to earn an unprecedented one trillion dollars' worth of stock.(Image credit: Etienne Laurent)

ai_summary: Tesla shareholders approved Elon Musk's record-breaking pay package, the largest in corporate history.
The deal could grant Musk stock worth up to $1 trillion over the next decade.
Over 75% of votes were cast in favor of the unprecedented pay plan.
Musk must meet specific benchmarks to receive the full compensation.
Some shareholders are mixed on the idea of investing in Musk's AI startup, xAI.

clusters.title: Satellite image of livestock in Sudan misinterpreted as mass graves
clusters.neutral_headline: RSF Agrees to Ceasefire in Sudan Amidst Conflict

items.title: Satellite image of livestock in Sudan misinterpreted as mass graves
items.standfirst: Following reported mass killings late October by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces in the beseiged city of El Fasher, internet users shared a screenshot from Google Earth purporting to show the site of a massacre. But according to satellite image analysts, this images are dated and in fact depict livestock. We spoke directly to the expert involved in this fact-check in this episode of Truth or Fake.
items.content: Following reported mass killings late October by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces in the beseiged city of El Fasher, internet users shared a screenshot from Google Earth purporting to show the site of a massacre. But according to satellite image analysts, this images are dated and in fact depict livestock. We spoke directly to the expert involved in this fact-check in this episode of Truth or Fake.

items.title: Sudan: RSF agree to truce proposal as new satellite images suggest 'mass graves' in El-Fasher
items.standfirst: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, who have been at war with the regular army for more than two years, have announced that they have agreed to a proposal for a humanitarian truce put forward by mediators. Meanwhile, Yale researchers released a report on Thursday stating that new satellite imagery had detected activity "consistent with mass graves" in the Sudanese city of El-Fasher, more than a week after mass killings were reported in the area.
items.content: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, who have been at war with the regular army for more than two years, have announced that they have agreed to a proposal for a humanitarian truce put forward by mediators. Meanwhile, Yale researchers released a report on Thursday stating that new satellite imagery had detected activity "consistent with mass graves" in the Sudanese city of El-Fasher, more than a week after mass killings were reported in the area.

items.title: RSF says it agrees to mediators’ ceasefire proposal in Sudan war
items.standfirst: Paramilitary says it will accept a ceasefire proposed by the Quad mediators - the US, Saudi Arabia, Egypt and the UAE.
items.content: Paramilitary says it will accept a ceasefire proposed by the Quad mediators - the US, Saudi Arabia, Egypt and the UAE.

items.title: Sudanese militia group accused of war crimes agrees to a ceasefire
items.standfirst: International mediators broker three-month halt to civil war as further evidence emerges of mass civilian killingsA Sudanese paramilitary group accused of killing thousands of unarmed civilians in an ethnically motivated massacre has agreed to a truce.The Rapid Support Forces (RSF), which is facing mounting criticism over apparent war crimes committed by its fighters in the city of El Fasher last month, said it had agreed to a “humanitarian ceasefire” put forward by the quad countries of the US, Egypt, the UAE and Saudi Arabia. Continue reading...
items.content: International mediators broker three-month halt to civil war as further evidence emerges of mass civilian killingsA Sudanese paramilitary group accused of killing thousands of unarmed civilians in an ethnically motivated massacre has agreed to a truce.The Rapid Support Forces (RSF), which is facing mounting criticism over apparent war crimes committed by its fighters in the city of El Fasher last month, said it had agreed to a “humanitarian ceasefire” put forward by the quad countries of the US, Egypt, the UAE and Saudi Arabia. Continue reading...

items.title: Sudan's RSF paramilitaries agree humanitarian ceasefire
items.standfirst: The group issued the statement after an 18-month siege of the city of el-Fasher in the western Darfur region.
items.content: The group issued the statement after an 18-month siege of the city of el-Fasher in the western Darfur region.

items.title: Sudan's paramilitary forces agree to US-led proposal for humanitarian ceasefire
items.standfirst: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) say they have agreed to a US-led proposal for a humanitarian ceasefire.
items.content: Sudan's paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) say they have agreed to a US-led proposal for a humanitarian ceasefire.

items.title: Sudan paramilitary group agrees to a ceasefire proposal after massacre in an army stronghold it overran
items.standfirst: A paramilitary group accused of killing thousands of Sudanese civilians in a war that has triggered a catastrophic humanitarian crisis said Thursday it had agreed to a ceasefire proposal from U.S.-led mediators, although an American official indicated a final deal had not been struck yet
items.content: A paramilitary group accused of killing thousands of Sudanese civilians in a war that has triggered a catastrophic humanitarian crisis said Thursday it had agreed to a ceasefire proposal from U.S.-led mediators, although an American official indicated a final deal had not been struck yet

ai_summary: The Rapid Support Forces (RSF) agreed to a humanitarian truce proposal.
The truce was proposed by mediators from the US, Saudi Arabia, Egypt, and the UAE.
Satellite images were misinterpreted as mass graves, but actually depicted livestock.
Yale researchers reported satellite imagery consistent with mass graves in El-Fasher.
The RSF is accused of war crimes and mass civilian killings.

items.title: Airlines scramble to comply with FAA order cutting thousands of flights
items.standfirst: The FAA ordered airlines to cut thousands of flights starting Friday as the agency deals with air traffic controller shortages during the government shutdown.
items.content: The FAA ordered airlines to cut thousands of flights starting Friday as the agency deals with air traffic controller shortages during the government shutdown.

items.title: 11/6: The Takeout with Major Garrett
items.standfirst: FAA to cut flights at 40 major airports due to ongoing government shutdown; President Trump teases cutting off funds to NYC after saying he would "help" Mayor-elect Mamdani.
items.content: FAA to cut flights at 40 major airports due to ongoing government shutdown; President Trump teases cutting off funds to NYC after saying he would "help" Mayor-elect Mamdani.

items.standfirst: Flight capacity will be cut at major airports as air traffic controllers report issues with fatigue amid staff shortages.
items.content: Flight capacity will be cut at major airports as air traffic controllers report issues with fatigue amid staff shortages.

Why it matters: With the Thanksgiving travel rush weeks away, the cuts will hit some of the…

items.title: These 40 airports will be impacted by the FAA's capacity cuts and flight cancellations
items.standfirst: The FAA's plan to slash airline capacity due to the government shutdown will hit some of the nation's busiest airports, including in Atlanta, Dallas, New York City and Los Angeles, according to a list released by the agency.
items.content: The FAA's plan to slash airline capacity due to the government shutdown will hit some of the nation's busiest airports, including in Atlanta, Dallas, New York City and Los Angeles, according to a list released by the agency.

items.title: Canceled flights live updates as government shutdown leaves airlines scrambling to comply with FAA order
Travelers brace for major disruptions as FAA cuts air traffic amid shutdown
items.standfirst: The FAA laid out a plan to cut as much as 10% percent of flights operating out of 40 major airports. Airlines already pre-emptively cancelled hundreds of flights in response. The Trump administration said the move was triggered by the government shutdown, as air traffic controllers working without…
items.content: The FAA laid out a plan to cut as much as 10% percent of flights operating out of 40 major airports. Airlines already pre-emptively cancelled hundreds of flights in response. The Trump administration said the move was triggered by the government shutdown, as air traffic controllers working without…

items.title: Airlines likely to adjust load to accomodate passengers as US orders flight reductions, expert says
items.standfirst: The Trump administration has ordered flight reductions at major airports due to a shortage of air traffic controllers during the longest U.S. government shutdown in history. Speaking on FRANCE 24, Michael McCormick, Associate Professor and Program Coordinator for B.S. in Air Traffic Management at Embry-Riddle University, says that airlines are likely to start adjusting their load to cope with the reduction in the number of flights.
items.content: The Trump administration has ordered flight reductions at major airports due to a shortage of air traffic controllers during the longest U.S. government shutdown in history. Speaking on FRANCE 24, Michael McCormick, Associate Professor and Program Coordinator for B.S. in Air Traffic Management at Embry-Riddle University, says that airlines are likely to start adjusting their load to cope with the reduction in the number of flights.

items.title: FAA Plan to Cut Flights Might Not Be a Total Nightmare
items.standfirst: The US government is aiming to ease the pressure on air traffic controllers suffering shutdown-related woes by curtailing flights. But airlines have experience with this kind of sudden disruption.
items.content: The US government is aiming to ease the pressure on air traffic controllers suffering shutdown-related woes by curtailing flights. But airlines have experience with this kind of sudden disruption.

ai_summary: The FAA ordered airlines to cut thousands of flights starting Friday.
The cuts are due to air traffic controller shortages during the government shutdown.
Flight capacity will be cut at 40 major airports across the US.
Airlines are scrambling to comply with the FAA order.
The cuts will impact major airports, potentially disrupting Thanksgiving travel.

clusters.title: Nancy Pelosi announces retirement after historic career in Congress
clusters.neutral_headline: Nancy Pelosi Announces Retirement from Congress

items.title: Nancy Pelosi announces retirement after historic career in Congress
items.standfirst: In a video letter to her constituents, California Democrat Nancy Pelosi ended months of speculation about her political future, announcing she would not seek reelection to Congress. Elected in 1987, Pelosi would become the most powerful women in politics as the first female House speaker. Nikole Killion looks back.
items.content: In a video letter to her constituents, California Democrat Nancy Pelosi ended months of speculation about her political future, announcing she would not seek reelection to Congress. Elected in 1987, Pelosi would become the most powerful women in politics as the first female House speaker. Nikole Killion looks back.

items.title: Pelosi a "once in a generation, perhaps once in a lifetime type figure," political analyst says
items.standfirst: California Congresswoman and former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is bringing nearly 40 years in politics to a close, announcing she will not seek reelection in 2027. CBS News' Erica Brown reports, and Lincoln Mitchell, Columbia University political analyst, joins "The Daily Report" to discuss.
items.content: California Congresswoman and former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is bringing nearly 40 years in politics to a close, announcing she will not seek reelection in 2027. CBS News' Erica Brown reports, and Lincoln Mitchell, Columbia University political analyst, joins "The Daily Report" to discuss.

items.title: Nancy Pelosi won't seek reelection, ending her storied career in the US House
items.standfirst: Nancy Pelosi, the first woman to serve as the powerful speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives, said on Thursday that she will not run for re-election to Congress in 2026, ending a four-decade career of a progressive Democratic icon often vilified by the right. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.
items.content: Nancy Pelosi, the first woman to serve as the powerful speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives, said on Thursday that she will not run for re-election to Congress in 2026, ending a four-decade career of a progressive Democratic icon often vilified by the right. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.

items.title: Nancy Pelosi announces retirement after decades in US Congress
items.standfirst: Pelosi made history as the first female Speaker and left an indelible mark on US politics.
items.content: Pelosi made history as the first female Speaker and left an indelible mark on US politics.

items.title: Former Speaker Nancy Pelosi will not seek reelection
items.standfirst: A shrewd political strategist, California Rep. Nancy Pelosi has had an unprecedented career in Congress. First elected in 1987, Pelosi became one of the most effective leaders of the Democratic Party.
items.content: A shrewd political strategist, California Rep. Nancy Pelosi has had an unprecedented career in Congress. First elected in 1987, Pelosi became one of the most effective leaders of the Democratic Party.(Image credit: Leigh Vogel)

ai_summary: Nancy Pelosi announced she will not seek reelection to Congress.
Pelosi's career spanned nearly 40 years, starting in 1987.
She served as the first female Speaker of the House.
Pelosi is considered a significant figure in US politics.
Her retirement ends a storied career as a progressive icon.

items.title: Judge orders Trump administration to fully fund SNAP benefits for November
items.standfirst: U.S. District Judge John McConnell ordered the Trump administration to provide the full food stamp benefits by Friday.
items.content: U.S. District Judge John McConnell ordered the Trump administration to provide the full food stamp benefits by Friday.

items.title: Federal judge orders Trump administration to fully fund SNAP benefits in November
Trump administration set to appeal judge's ruling on SNAP benefits
items.standfirst: The Trump administration has indicated it will appeal a federal judge’s ruling that it must act by Friday to help "hungry" recipients.
items.content: The Trump administration has indicated it will appeal a federal judge’s ruling that it must act by Friday to help "hungry" recipients.

items.title: US judge orders Trump administration to fully fund Snap benefits in November
items.standfirst: Ruling comes in response to a challenge to administration’s offer to only partly fund US food benefits amid shutdownA federal judge in Rhode Island ordered the Trump administration on Thursday to find the money to fully fund food stamps for 42 million low-income Americans in November by Friday, in a rebuke to the government’s plan to only provide reduced aid during the shutdown.US district judge John J McConnell Jr criticized the administration’s plan to partly fund Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (Snap) benefits in November, saying it had failed to comply with an order he issued on Saturday requiring the government to ensure Americans received full or partial benefits no later than Wednesday. Continue reading...
items.content: Ruling comes in response to a challenge to administration’s offer to only partly fund US food benefits amid shutdownA federal judge in Rhode Island ordered the Trump administration on Thursday to find the money to fully fund food stamps for 42 million low-income Americans in November by Friday, in a rebuke to the government’s plan to only provide reduced aid during the shutdown.US district judge John J McConnell Jr criticized the administration’s plan to partly fund Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (Snap) benefits in November, saying it had failed to comply with an order he issued on Saturday requiring the government to ensure Americans received full or partial benefits no later than Wednesday. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A judge ordered the Trump administration to fully fund SNAP benefits by Friday.
The ruling is in response to the administration's plan to provide reduced aid.
The administration had planned to only partially fund SNAP benefits.
The judge criticized the administration's plan to cut food assistance.
The Trump administration is set to appeal the judge's ruling.

clusters.title: US school teacher shot by six-year-old student awarded $10m
clusters.neutral_headline: Teacher Shot by Student Awarded $10 Million

items.title: US school teacher shot by six-year-old student awarded $10m
items.standfirst: Abby Zwerner, 28, was shot in 2023 as she sat in a first-grade classroom and sustained life-threatening injuries.
items.content: Abby Zwerner, 28, was shot in 2023 as she sat in a first-grade classroom and sustained life-threatening injuries.

items.title: Teacher shot by first grader awarded $10 million in civil case
items.standfirst: A jury awarded $10 million to former first grade Virginia teacher Abby Zwerner, who was shot and seriously wounded by a 6-year-old student in 2023, in a civil case that accused the school's former assistant principal of ignoring multiple warnings the day of the shooting. Scott MacFarlane reports.
items.content: A jury awarded $10 million to former first grade Virginia teacher Abby Zwerner, who was shot and seriously wounded by a 6-year-old student in 2023, in a civil case that accused the school's former assistant principal of ignoring multiple warnings the day of the shooting. Scott MacFarlane reports.

items.title: A former teacher shot by her 6-year-old student wins a $10 million jury verdict
items.standfirst: Abby Zwerner's lawsuit accused an administrator of ignoring warnings that a child had a gun at the Newport News, Va., school that day. A bullet damaged her left hand and remains in her chest.
items.content: Abby Zwerner's lawsuit accused an administrator of ignoring warnings that a child had a gun at the Newport News, Va., school that day. A bullet damaged her left hand and remains in her chest.(Image credit: Stephen M. Katz)

ai_summary: A jury awarded $10 million to a teacher shot by a first-grade student.
The lawsuit accused an administrator of ignoring warnings.
The shooting occurred in a Virginia school in 2023.
The teacher, Abby Zwerner, sustained life-threatening injuries.
A bullet remains in Zwerner's chest.

clusters.title: Is Zohran Mamdani ready to stand up to Donald Trump?
clusters.neutral_headline: Ugandans Celebrate Mamdani's New York Mayoral Win

items.title: Is Zohran Mamdani ready to stand up to Donald Trump?
items.standfirst: Making history as the first Muslim elected New York mayor, Mamdani pledges to serve all communities and challenge Trump.
items.content: Making history as the first Muslim elected New York mayor, Mamdani pledges to serve all communities and challenge Trump.

items.title: Pride in Uganda after Mamdani’s victory in the New York mayoral race
items.standfirst: Ugandans in Kampala react to the election of Zohran Mamdani as New York’s new mayor. Born in Uganda and now the city’s first Muslim mayor, Mamdani’s victory sparks pride and hope – with many young people inspired by his progressive agenda and stance against Trump-era policies.
items.content: Ugandans in Kampala react to the election of Zohran Mamdani as New York’s new mayor. Born in Uganda and now the city’s first Muslim mayor, Mamdani’s victory sparks pride and hope – with many young people inspired by his progressive agenda and stance against Trump-era policies.

items.title: Ugandans view Mamdani’s NYC win as a ‘beacon of hope’ amid democratic struggle
items.standfirst: Ugandans react with joy after Kampala-born Mamdani’s victory during a trying time for democracy in east AfricaUgandans reacted with joy and hope to the news that Kampala-born Zohran Mamdani had been elected mayor of New York City, amid a stormy democratic and rights environment in east Africa.Mamdani, who was born in Uganda 34 years ago to a family of Indian origin, on Tuesday defeated former governor Andrew Cuomo and Republican Curtis Sliwa to become the city’s first Muslim mayor and the first of south Asian heritage. Continue reading...
items.content: Ugandans react with joy after Kampala-born Mamdani’s victory during a trying time for democracy in east AfricaUgandans reacted with joy and hope to the news that Kampala-born Zohran Mamdani had been elected mayor of New York City, amid a stormy democratic and rights environment in east Africa.Mamdani, who was born in Uganda 34 years ago to a family of Indian origin, on Tuesday defeated former governor Andrew Cuomo and Republican Curtis Sliwa to become the city’s first Muslim mayor and the first of south Asian heritage. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Zohran Mamdani, born in Uganda, was elected New York City mayor.
Mamdani is the city's first Muslim mayor.
His victory sparked pride and hope among Ugandans.
Many are inspired by his progressive agenda.
Ugandans view the win as a beacon of hope.

clusters.title: Supreme Court allows Trump's passport sex marker restrictions
clusters.neutral_headline: Supreme Court Allows Trump's Passport Sex Marker Policy

items.title: Supreme Court allows Trump's passport sex marker restrictions
items.standfirst: The U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday allowed President Donald Trump’s administration to enforce a policy preventing transgender and nonbinary people from selecting passport sex markers that reflect their gender identity, a decision that marks the latest in a string of courtroom victories for the administration on issues of gender and identity.
items.content: The U.S. Supreme Court on Thursday allowed President Donald Trump’s administration to enforce a policy preventing transgender and nonbinary people from selecting passport sex markers that reflect their gender identity, a decision that marks the latest in a string of courtroom victories for the administration on issues of gender and identity.

items.title: News Wrap: Former Speaker Nancy Pelosi will retire next year
items.standfirst: In our news wrap Thursday, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi will not run for re-election next year, the Supreme Court is letting the Trump administration block transgender and non-binary people from choosing their own gender identity on passports and a jury in Virginia awarded $10 million to the…
items.content: In our news wrap Thursday, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi will not run for re-election next year, the Supreme Court is letting the Trump administration block transgender and non-binary people from choosing their own gender identity on passports and a jury in Virginia awarded $10 million to the…

items.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to prohibit gender election on passports
items.standfirst: The court's decision is not a final ruling, however; it just permits Trump's passport policy to go into effect while litigation continues in the lower courts.
items.content: The court's decision is not a final ruling, however; it just permits Trump's passport policy to go into effect while litigation continues in the lower courts.(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)

ai_summary: The Supreme Court allowed the Trump administration's passport policy to continue.
The policy prevents transgender and nonbinary people from choosing their sex marker.
The decision is not a final ruling, but allows the policy to be enforced.
Litigation continues in lower courts.
The decision is the latest in a string of courtroom victories for the administration.

clusters.title: Trump announces deal to lower weight loss drug prices in some cases

items.title: Trump announces deal to lower weight loss drug prices in some cases
items.standfirst: The deal, with Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk, is expected to lower the price of obesity drugs to between $149 and $350 per month in some cases, officials said.
items.content: The deal, with Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk, is expected to lower the price of obesity drugs to between $149 and $350 per month in some cases, officials said.

items.title: Trump announces deal to lower weight loss drug prices for some patients
items.standfirst: President Trump announced a deal to drastically lower the price of weight loss drugs for some Americans. Dr. Jon LaPook has more.
items.content: President Trump announced a deal to drastically lower the price of weight loss drugs for some Americans. Dr. Jon LaPook has more.

items.title: Rockstar Games delays Grand Theft Auto VI – again – to late 2026
items.standfirst: The hugely anticipated sequel was due to arrive in May of next year but has been pushed back to November 2026Rockstar Games’s Grand Theft Auto VI, which was due to release on 26 May next year, has been delayed again – this time to the end of 2026. It has now been nearly two years since the game was announced, and more than 12 years since the release of Grand Theft Auto V.“Grand Theft Auto VI will now release on Thursday, November 19, 2026,” reads Rockstar Games’s statement on X. “We are sorry for adding additional time to what we realize has been a long wait, but these extra months will allow us to finish the game with the level of polish you have come to expect and deserve.” Continue reading...
items.content: The hugely anticipated sequel was due to arrive in May of next year but has been pushed back to November 2026Rockstar Games’s Grand Theft Auto VI, which was due to release on 26 May next year, has been delayed again – this time to the end of 2026. items.title: Philippines declares state of emergency after typhoon Kalmaegi death toll passes 100
items.standfirst: The deaths were mostly from drowning in flash floods, with 127 people still missing, many in the hard-hit central province of CebuPhilippine president Ferdinand Marcos Jr has declared a state of emergency after typhoon Kalmaegi left at least 114 people dead and nearly 130 missing in central provinces in the deadliest natural disaster to hit the country this year.The deaths were mostly from drowning in flash floods, and 127 people were still missing, many in the hard-hit central province of Cebu. The tropical cyclone blew out of the archipelago on Wednesday into the South China Sea. Continue reading...

items.title: Peru declares Mexican president unwelcome amid escalating asylum dispute
items.standfirst: Peru’s Congress on Thursday declared Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum persona non grata, deepening a diplomatic crisis triggered by Mexico’s decision to grant asylum to former Peruvian Prime Minister Betssy Chavez. The move follows Peru’s break in diplomatic ties with Mexico and ongoing tensions over the case of the ex-official sheltered at Mexico’s embassy in Lima.

items.standfirst: U.S. President Donald Trump announced on Thursday that Kazakhstan will join the Abraham Accords, expanding the normalisation framework between Israel and Muslim-majority nations. The move, confirmed after Trump’s call with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Kazakh President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, marks the first new entrant to the accords since Trump returned to office.

clusters.title: Senate blocks Democrats’ bid to check Trump power over Venezuela strikes
clusters.neutral_headline: Senate Blocks Democrats' Bid on Venezuela Strikes

items.title: Senate blocks Democrats’ bid to check Trump power over Venezuela strikes
items.standfirst: Resolution fails 49-51 with only two Republican senators voting in favor as president increases military buildupThe US Senate on Thursday blocked a Democratic war powers resolution that would have forced Donald Trump to seek congressional approval to launch strikes in Venezuela, allowing the president to remain unchecked in his ability to expand his military campaign against the country.The 49-51 vote against passing the resolution, mostly along party lines, came a month after a previous effort to stop strikes against alleged drug trafficking boats in international waters similarly failed, 48-51. Continue reading...
items.content: Resolution fails 49-51 with only two Republican senators voting in favor as president increases military buildupThe US Senate on Thursday blocked a Democratic war powers resolution that would have forced Donald Trump to seek congressional approval to launch strikes in Venezuela, allowing the president to remain unchecked in his ability to expand his military campaign against the country.The 49-51 vote against passing the resolution, mostly along party lines, came a month after a previous effort to stop strikes against alleged drug trafficking boats in international waters similarly failed, 48-51. Continue reading...

items.title: Senate Republicans block bid to limit Trump’s war powers on Venezuela
items.standfirst: U.S. Senate Republicans on Thursday blocked a resolution that would have barred President Donald Trump from launching military action against Venezuela without congressional approval, underscoring deep divisions over the administration’s escalating campaign in the Caribbean.
items.content: U.S. Senate Republicans on Thursday blocked a resolution that would have barred President Donald Trump from launching military action against Venezuela without congressional approval, underscoring deep divisions over the administration’s escalating campaign in the Caribbean.

ai_summary: The Senate blocked a Democratic war powers resolution.
The resolution would have checked Trump's power over Venezuela strikes.
The vote was 49-51, with only two Republicans voting in favor.
The resolution would have required congressional approval for strikes.

items.title: Peloton recalls more than 800,000 US exercise bikes over faulty seat post
items.standfirst: Shares fall as users urged to stop using bikes immediately and warned assembly poses risk of falls and injuriesThe US Consumer Product Safety Commission said on Thursday that Peloton Interactive was recalling about 833,000 units of its Original Bike+ Model PL02 after reports that the seat post assembly could break during use, posing a risk of falls and injuries.The consumer safety regulator said the fitness products maker had received three reports of the seat post breaking and detaching during use, including two incidents that resulted in injuries from falls. Continue reading...
items.content: Shares fall as users urged to stop using bikes immediately and warned assembly poses risk of falls and injuriesThe US Consumer Product Safety Commission said on Thursday that Peloton Interactive was recalling about 833,000 units of its Original Bike+ Model PL02 after reports that the seat post assembly could break during use, posing a risk of falls and injuries.The consumer safety regulator said the fitness products maker had received three reports of the seat post breaking and detaching during use, including two incidents that resulted in injuries from falls. Continue reading...

clusters.title: World’s oldest president sworn in for eighth term in Cameroon
clusters.neutral_headline: Cameroon's President Sworn In for Eighth Term

items.title: World’s oldest president sworn in for eighth term in Cameroon
items.standfirst: Paul Biya has been in power since 1982 - the opposition says the election was rigged.
items.content: Paul Biya has been in power since 1982 - the opposition says the election was rigged.

items.title: Cameroon: World’s oldest president sworn in for eighth term
items.standfirst: Cameroon’s Paul Biya has been sworn in for his eighth consecutive term after winning last month’s presidential election. Issa Tchiroma Bakary, the other presidential candidate, maintains that he was the rightful winner of the poll and has accused the authorities of fraud - allegations they have denied.
items.content: Cameroon’s Paul Biya has been sworn in for his eighth consecutive term after winning last month’s presidential election. Issa Tchiroma Bakary, the other presidential candidate, maintains that he was the rightful winner of the poll and has accused the authorities of fraud - allegations they have denied.

ai_summary: Paul Biya has been in power since 1982, now sworn in for eighth term.
The opposition claims the election was rigged.
Issa Tchiroma Bakary alleges fraud in the election.
Cameroon's president won last month's presidential election.

items.title: 2025 set to be among hottest years on record

clusters.title: 2 elderly lions euthanized, fate of 5 more uncertain after wildlife sanctuary hit by financial woes
clusters.neutral_headline: New Zealand Wildlife Park Euthanizes Lions

items.title: 2 elderly lions euthanized, fate of 5 more uncertain after wildlife sanctuary hit by financial woes
items.standfirst: A New Zealand wildlife sanctuary says it has euthanized two of its seven elderly lions after closing for financial reasons, with five more at risk of the same fate.
items.content: A New Zealand wildlife sanctuary says it has euthanized two of its seven elderly lions after closing for financial reasons, with five more at risk of the same fate.

items.title: Troubled New Zealand wildlife park euthanizes two lions, fate of five more unclear
items.standfirst: Members of the public have pleaded for a reprieve for the remaining lions, while former staff members hope the sanctuary will reconsider putting them downA troubled New Zealand wildlife park says it has been forced to euthanise two of its elderly lions, with the fate of its remaining five lions unclear, after it ran into financial difficulties.The privately owned Kamo Wildlife Sanctuary in the northern city of Whangārei closed its doors on the weekend. Continue reading...
items.content: Members of the public have pleaded for a reprieve for the remaining lions, while former staff members hope the sanctuary will reconsider putting them downA troubled New Zealand wildlife park says it has been forced to euthanise two of its elderly lions, with the fate of its remaining five lions unclear, after it ran into financial difficulties.The privately owned Kamo Wildlife Sanctuary in the northern city of Whangārei closed its doors on the weekend. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A New Zealand wildlife sanctuary euthanized two elderly lions.
The sanctuary closed due to financial difficulties.
Five more lions are at risk of being euthanized.
Members of the public are pleading for the remaining lions.
